channel.title: CTF Hacker
channel.description: CTF Writeups, Security, Spreading the knowledge

item.title: Pwning Gnomes: CounterHack HolidayHack 2015 Writeup
item.description: It is that time of year again! Time for the HolidayHack presented by CounterHack! This one is going to be fairly long, but boy are there a lot of cool challenges here. Everything from network forensics, web, image forensics, and even a pwnable.

item.title: CMU Binary Bomb meets Symbolic Execution and Radare
item.description: Symbolic execution has been a topic I have been meaning to jump into for a few months. Today we will look at how to apply symbolic execution to the Carnegie Melon Binary Bomb lab.

item.title: Voice Robot plays Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes
item.description: Here is the video of my voice activated robot Bombly dominating Hardcore in the game Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes.

item.title: HITCON - PhishingMe
item.description:
Sent me a .doc, I will open it if your subject is "HITCON 2015"!
Find the flag under my file system. 
p.s. I've enabled Macro for you. ^_________________^
phishing.me.hitcon.2015@gmail.com.

item.title: Vulnhub - Brainpan3
item.description: Brainpan3 is a typical boot2root VM that we boot and attempt to gain root access. This one is a bit long, but I hope it is entertaining and informative. Strap in!

item.title: MMACTF 2015 - Moneygame
item.description: We are presented with a stock market game. We have to time the market just right in order to get 10x our initial cash pile. Psh.. easy peasy

item.title: SaintCon 2015 PreCTF - 4
item.description:
-- CIPHERTEXT --
AEBRVHWWMQHURVWFFIKVYFUCDG
To Decrypt this Message, you will need to learn how a US President encrypted messages while in Paris France.

item.description: * thebarbershopper has joined the channel

item.description: Upon connecting, we are given a prompt which asks for the following items:

item.title: PoliCTF 2015 - John's Shuffle
item.description: John is completely drunk and unable to protect his poor stack.. Fortunately he can still count on his terrific shuffling skills.

item.title: PoliCTF 2015 - John's Library
item.description: Do you like reading books? here we have the best collection ever! you can even save some books for future reading!! enjoy noob!

item.title: SECCON 2014 - Let's Disassemble
item.description: We are given a service that returns hex bytes that are assembly instructions. Our job is to create a client to respond with the correct instruction cooresponding to the given assembly.

item.title: PicoCTF 2014 - Steve's List Backup
item.description: What a fun challenge! We have a pwned website and we have to figure out how to pwn it as well.
